title: 107_s2771
content: The Act is titled the "John F. Kennedy Center Plaza Authorization Act of 2002" and it amends the John F. Kennedy Center Act by redesignating sections and adding a new section for the John F. Kennedy Center Plaza. In this section, definitions are provided for terms such as 'air right', 'Center', 'green space', and 'Plaza', which refer to specific aspects of the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts project. The term 'Project' refers to the Plaza project described in the TEA-21 report, involving construction of the Plaza and improved access for bicycles, pedestrians, and vehicles around the Center. This includes planning, design, engineering, and construction of the Plaza. The Secretary of Transportation is responsible for the Plaza project, including construction, buildings, transportation improvements, and other elements identified in the TEA-21 report. The TEA-21 report is a document submitted to Congress outlining the project details. The Secretary is responsible for planning, design, engineering, and construction of the Project, excluding buildings on the Plaza. Memoranda of agreement will be entered into with the Board and other agencies to facilitate the Project. Consultation with the Board is required to maximize efficiencies in executing the Project. The Board is responsible for constructing buildings on the Plaza for the Project and may receive air rights transfers from the District of Columbia. They can also use nonappropriated funds to construct buildings on the Plaza. The Board is responsible for planning, designing, engineering, and constructing buildings on the Plaza for the Project. Private contributions can be acknowledged inside the buildings but not on the exterior. The District of Columbia is responsible for modifying the highway system. The Mayor of the District of Columbia has exclusive authority to modify the highway system and convey real estate interests for the Project, regardless of State or local laws. The Mayor of the District of Columbia has the authority to convey real estate interests to the Board for the Project without compensation. They can also enter agreements with the Board and other agencies to facilitate the planning and construction. Upon completion, maintenance and oversight of roadways and sidewalks will be the responsibility of the Project. Upon completion of the Project, responsibility for maintenance and oversight of roadways, sidewalks, and green spaces modified or improved for the Project shall remain with the respective owners. The Board shall own, operate, and maintain buildings and green spaces on the Plaza established for the Project. The Secretary may realign national highways related to proposed changes. The Secretary may realign national highways to improve traffic flow near the Center, including access between Interstate Route 66 and the Center. Authorization of $400,000,000 for the John F. Kennedy Center Plaza project for fiscal years 2003 through 2010. The John F. Kennedy Center Act authorizes $400,000,000 for the Plaza project from 2003 to 2010. The amendment allows the Board to negotiate contracts for building construction, landscaping, and environmental systems on the Plaza. The amendment to the John F. Kennedy Center Act authorizes the Board to negotiate contracts for construction, landscaping, and environmental systems for the Plaza project. The Board, in consultation with the Secretary of Transportation, will amend the map available for public inspection. The Senate passed S. 2771 on July 26, 2002, amending the John F. Kennedy Center Act to authorize the Secretary of Transportation to construct a plaza near the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.
